result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L Cash

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Att Nelson

Pre-trial conference on October 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF596, 21CM377, 22CF424 called at 1:31 PM 
Defendant Brandon L Cash appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court reviews court records. 

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CF424: 
The Defendant verifies date of birth; indicates does not have an address at this time. 
The Court directs Mr. Cash is to provide address to Clerk of Courts within 48 hours of release. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel 

As to Case 22CF424, The Court requires a $1500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Witness 2 or Victim 1
--no presence at residences of  Witness 2 or Victim 1
--not to discuss the case with Witness 1
--no possession of any dangerous weapons 

As to Cases 21CF596 & 21CM377, The Court requires a single $2500 CASH Bond, with conditions to continue as previously ordered to include WCS/SCRAM condition. 
recess 1:45  pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/19/22 at 11:00am  (2) Preliminary Hearing(22CF424 & 21CF596))/Status Conference(21CM377) on 11/8/22 at 8:30am

Order to Seal Victim Key
The original document was titled: Victim Witness Key
The original history event date is: 09-23-2022
Reason: The Defendant is in warrant status in multiple pending cases including Jefferson County Case No(s). 21CM377, and 21CF596, and Walworth County Case No.(s) 21CF575 and 21CM390
Proposed Order to Seal Victim Key
Defendant has pending cases assigned to Branch 1
